children.name: div
children: The Beatitudes

children.name: div
children:
When Jesus saw the
                crowds, he went up on the mountain. And when he sat down, his
                disciples came to him.

Then he opened his
                mouth and taught them, saying,

children.name: span
children: “Blessed are the poor in spirit,

children.name: span
children: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

children.name: span
children: Blessed are those who mourn,

children.name: span
children: for they will be comforted.

children.name: span
children: Blessed are the meek,

children.name: span
children: for they will inherit the earth.

children.name: span
children:
Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for
                    righteousness,

children.name: span
children: for they will be filled.

children.name: span
children: Blessed are the merciful,

children.name: span
children: for they will receive mercy.

children.name: span
children: Blessed are the pure in heart,

children.name: span
children: for they will see God.

children.name: span
children: Blessed are the peacemakers,

children.name: span
children: for they will be called sons of God.

children.name: span
children:
Blessed are those who are persecuted for righteousness'
                    sake,

children.name: span
children: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

children.name: span
children:
Blessed are you when others reproach you, persecute you,
                    and say all kinds of evil against you falsely on my
                    account.

children.name: span
div
children: Salt and Light

children.name: span
children:
“You are the salt of the earth, but if salt loses its
                    flavor, with what shall it be seasoned? It is no longer fit
                    for anything but to be thrown out and trampled under
                    people's feet.

children.name: span
children:
“You are the light of the world. A city set on a hill
                    cannot be hidden,

children.name: span
children:
nor do people light a lamp and put it under a basket, but
                    on a lampstand, and it shines for all who are in the
                    house.

children.name: span
children:
Let your light shine before others in such a way that they
                    may see your good works and glorify your Father in
                    heaven.

children.name: div
children: Christ Fulfills the Law and the Prophets

children.name: span
children:
“Do not think that I have come to abolish the Law or the
                    Prophets. I have not come to abolish them, but to fulfill
                    them.

children.name: span
children:
For truly I say to you, until heaven and earth pass away,
                    not one letter or stroke of a letter will by any means pass
                    from the law until all is accomplished.

children.name: span
children:
Therefore whoever does away with one of the least of these
                    commandments and teaches others to do likewise will be
                    called least in the kingdom of heaven, but whoever practices
                    them and teaches them will be called great in the kingdom of
                    heaven.

children.name: span
children:
For I tell you, unless your righteousness surpasses that of
                    the scribes and Pharisees, you will certainly not enter the
                    kingdom of heaven.

children.name: div
children: Anger

children.name: span
children:
“You have heard that it was said to those of old, ‘Yoʋ
                    shall not murder,’ and, ‘Whoever murders will be subject to
                    judgment.’

children.name: span
children: But I say to you that everyone who is

children.name: span
children: rashly 95.4% ¦ — CT 1.9%

children.name: span
children:
rashly angry with his brother will be subject to judgment.
                    Whoever says to his brother, ‘Yoʋ idiot,’ will be subject to
                    the Sanhedrin. And whoever says, ‘Yoʋ fool,’ will be subject
                    to the fires of hell.

children.name: span
children:
So if yoʋ are offering yoʋr gift at the altar and there
                    remember that yoʋr brother has something against yoʋ,

children.name: span
children:
leave yoʋr gift there before the altar and go. First be
                    reconciled to yoʋr brother, and then come and offer yoʋr
                    gift.

children.name: span
children:
Make friends with yoʋr adversary quickly while yoʋ are on
                    the way with him, lest yoʋr adversary hand yoʋ over to the
                    judge, and the judge

children.name: span
children: hand yoʋ over ¦ — CT

children.name: span
children:
hand yoʋ over to the guard, and yoʋ be thrown into
                    prison.

children.name: span
children:
Truly I say to yoʋ, yoʋ will certainly not come out of
                    there until yoʋ have paid the last penny.

children.name: div
children: Adultery

children.name: span
children: “You have heard that it was

children.name: span
children: said ¦ said to those of old ANT TR

children.name: span
children: said, ‘Yoʋ shall not commit adultery.’

children.name: span
children:
But I say to you that everyone who looks at a woman to lust
                    after her has already committed adultery with her in his
                    heart.

children.name: span
children:
So if yoʋr right eye causes yoʋ to stumble, pluck it out
                    and throw it away from yoʋ. For it is better for yoʋ to have
                    one of yoʋr members perish, than for yoʋr whole body to be
                    thrown into hell.

children.name: span
children:
And if yoʋr right hand causes yoʋ to stumble, cut it off
                    and throw it away from yoʋ. For it is better for yoʋ to have
                    one of yoʋr members perish, than for yoʋr whole body
                    to

children.name: span
children: be thrown ¦ go CT

children.name: span
children: be thrown into hell.

children.name: div
children: Divorce

children.name: span
children:
“It was also said, ‘Whoever divorces his wife must give her
                    a certificate of divorce.’

children.name: span
children: But I say to you that

children.name: span
children: whoever ¦ anyone who CT

children.name: span
children:
whoever divorces his wife, apart from a matter of
                    fornication, makes her commit adultery. And whoever marries
                    a divorced woman commits adultery.

children.name: div
children: Oaths

children.name: span
children:
“Again, you have heard that it was said to those of old,
                    ‘Yoʋ shall not break an oath, but shall keep yoʋr oaths to
                    the Lord.’

children.name: span
children:
But I say to you, do not swear at all, neither by heaven,
                    for it is the throne of God;

children.name: span
children:
nor by the earth, for it is the footstool of his feet; nor
                    by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.

children.name: span
children:
Neither shall yoʋ swear by yoʋr head, for yoʋ cannot make
                    one hair white or black.

children.name: span
children:
But let your ‘Yes’ be ‘Yes’ and your ‘No’ be ‘No’; for
                    whatever is more than these is from the evil one.

children.name: div
children: Retaliation

children.name: span
children:
“You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye and a
                    tooth for a tooth.’

children.name: span
children:
But I say to you, do not resist one who is evil. Rather, if
                    anyone slaps yoʋ on

children.name: span
children: the ¦ yoʋr BYZ HF NA TR WH

children.name: span
children: the right cheek, turn to him the other also.

children.name: span
children:
If anyone wants to sue yoʋ and take away yoʋr tunic, let
                    him have yoʋr cloak also.

children.name: span
children:
And if anyone presses yoʋ into service for one mile, go
                    with him two.

children.name: span
children:
Give to him who asks of yoʋ, and do not turn away from him
                    who wants to borrow from yoʋ.

children.name: div
children: Love for Enemies

children.name: span
children:
“You have heard that it was said, ‘Yoʋ shall love yoʋr
                    neighbor and hate yoʋr enemy.’

children.name: span
children: But I say to you, love your enemies,

children.name: span
children:
bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate
                        you, 90% {TR 1.2%} ¦ — CT 0.8%

children.name: span
children:
bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you,
                    and pray for those who

children.name: span
children: mistreat you and 87.6% ¦ — CT 0.8%

children.name: span
children: mistreat you and persecute you,

children.name: span
children:
so that you may be sons of your Father in heaven. For he
                    makes his sun rise on the evil and the good, and sends rain
                    on the righteous and the unrighteous.

children.name: span
children:
For if you love those who love you, what reward do you
                    have? Do not even the tax collectors do the same?

children.name: span
children: And if you greet only your

children.name: span
children: friends ¦ brothers CT TR

children.name: span
children:
friends, what are you doing that is out of the ordinary? Do
                    not even the

children.name: span
children:
tax collectors do that 76.6% ¦ Gentiles do the same CT
                        3.7%

children.name: span
children: tax collectors do that?

children.name: span
children: You therefore shall be perfect, just as your

children.name: span
children: Father in heaven ¦ heavenly Father CT

children.name: span
children: Father in heaven is perfect.
